entry.title: Foreign Language Proficiency at US Intelligence Agencies
entry.content:
According to this article, US spy agencies employ fewer than 2000 people proficient in Middle Eastern languages.

Spanish speakers outnumber Arabic by a more than 2-to-1 margin. But I’m not surprised. We share a border with Mexico and immigration and the “War on Drugs” are just as important (maybe more so), as the “War on Terrorism”.

What surprises me is this — why do we have more French speakers than Russian or Korean?

entry.title: Obama Blamed for Katrina Response
entry.content:
According to a new PPP poll, more people in Louisiana blame Barack Obama for the slow response during Hurricane Katrina than they do George W. Bush. FYI – Obama was a freshman Senator at the time.

I’m no longer amazed at the ignorance or hatred that some Americans feel toward Obama, so this doesn’t surprise me. But how much of this is that and how much is – “I can’t believe you just asked me this dumb question?”

Survey Results

Who do you think was more responsible for the poor response to Hurricane Katrina: 
George W. Bush or Barack Obama?

George W. Bush ............................................. 28%   
Barack Obama................................................ 29%  
Not sure ................................................... 44%
Source: Public Policy Polling

entry.title: Alter Ego?
entry.content: Apparently, I’m not the only one who thinks Bob Filner bares a striking resemblance to The Joker?

entry.title: Al Jazeera America Debuts
entry.content:
After acquiring Current TV earlier this year, Al Jazeera is set to debut in the US. The programming schedule includes a day filled with live news coverage. The evening lineup features America Tonight, the flagship magazine program hosted by award-winning journalist Joie Chen.

Chen isn’t the only TV news journalist making the move from one of the major networks. Former NBC news host John Seigenthaler will anchor the primetime news. Ali Velshi will develop and host a program focused on business. Velshi was CNN’s Chief Business Correspondent. And former CNN anchor Soledad O’Brien signed on as a special correspondent. Her production company will contribute short-form segments to “America Tonight”.

In a move to appease the cable gods, Al Jazeera is now blocking visitors located in the US from accessing its international feed and news videos on YouTube. Tough luck if you either 1) don’t have cable or 2) your cable company doesn’t off the channel.

If you live in the US and would still like to access Al Jazeera’s live stream or YouTube videos, you’d need to sign up with a VPN (virtual private network) provider that operates servers located outside the US. I use VPNBook. They offer fast, unlimited service for free and it’s ad-free, so no banners or pop-ups to contend with while you watch.

Initial Programming Schedule
Inside Story – Weekdays 5pm ET / 2pm PT
Real Money With Ali Velshi – Weekdays 7pm ET / 4pm PT
The Stream – Weekdays 7:30pm ET / 4:30pm PT
Nightly News – Monday – Sunday 8pm ET America Tonight – Weekdays 9pm ET & PT
Consider This – Weekdays 10pm ET & PT
Fault Lines – Sundays 7pm ET / 4pm PT & Fridays 9:30pm ET / 6:30pm PT
TechKnow – Sundays 7:30pm ET / 4:30pm PT

entry.title: The 3 Best Things About Netflix Streaming
entry.content:
Netflix streaming gets a bad rap sometimes. Here are three reasons for why having a streaming plan is not so bad. In fact, it’s pretty good.

  1. Season/Series Catch-Up
  2. Foreign Movies & Television
  3. Original Programming

Reason #1: Season / Series Catch-Up

I have a confession to make. I did not watch Breaking Bad when it premiered. As someone born and raised in DC and seeing the effects of crime and drugs in the community, I couldn’t see how watching a high school chemistry teacher with terminal cancer from Albuquerque, morph into a kingpin meth dealer would be appealing to me. But everyone was talking about it, so I thought I’d give it a try. And a one episode experiment turned into a binge.

I also didn’t watch The Walking Dead. I like zombies, but not that much. I started watching at the suggestion of friend who said it wasn’t just about zombies. And she was right. It’s not really about zombies. If there is ever a zombie apocalypse, the zombies are the least of your worries. Watch out for the charismatic man who wears an eyepatch and whistles creepily.

Those are just two examples. Other great series to watch: American Horror Story, 30 Rock, It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia and The West Wing.

Reason #2: Foreign Movies & Televison

Let’s face it, American movies are entertaining but they lack originality. You know what’s going to happen because it’s the same story told over and over again. I find foreign films are much more original and have some of the best acting you’ll ever see from people you’ve never heard of. It’s not surprising Hollywood remakes foreign films and not just the horror flicks (e.g. The Ring, The Grudge).

If you liked the The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo (US) and haven’t seen the original trilogy, you owe it to yourself to watch it. Spike Lee is remaking the film Oldboy starring Josh Brolin (I’m not sure how I feel about this). Watch the Korean version first.

If you’re into CSI, NCIS and Criminal Minds, you’ll love British crime/drama. Some of my favorites: Sherlock, Luther, Wallander, and Wallander (original Swedish version).

Reason #3: Original Progamming

This is the least compelling reason, but I think it will get better. House of Cards with Kevin Spacey (based on the British television show) was an instant hit when it debuted in February becoming Netflix’s most streamed show. But not only was the show good, Netflix did something unconventional by releasing the entire season at once. Amazon’s Instant Video service has since followed the same model.

If you’re a Twilight fan (I’m not), you may like Hemlock Grove (I didn’t). Other Netflix produced shows include: Orange is the New Black, Lilyhammer and Arrested Development (not original but revived).

So there you have it. There are more than enough great shows to watch that will keep you paying the $8/month it costs for a subscription.

entry.title: Half Empty or Half Full?
entry.content:
31 Charts That Will Restore Your Faith In Humanity

“It would be a mistake to become cynical.”

These 31 Charts Will Destroy Your Faith In Humanity

entry.title: Seattle Storm iPhone App
entry.content:
Are you a Seattle Storm fan? Get the iPhone app today from Apple App Store.

Features:

  • Latest news from Storm blogs
  • Official Seattle Storm Twitter feed
  • Player and coach bios
  • Season schedule with links to boxscores
  • League standings
  • Official Youtube video channel
  • Share articles with Email and Facebook
